parameters.name: ORBIT_NUMBER
parameters.description: Orbit Number (Orb).

parameters.name: ACCUM_TIME
parameters.description:
Accumulation Time (ACCUM_t) per record.               
                        Values are 0.1500, 0.2667 or 0.5000.

parameters.name: DT
parameters.description:
Delta-Time (delta-t or dt) per record.                
                        This is half the accumulation time used for the record
                        such that the start time of the record is UTC - dt,   
                        and end time is UTC + dt (seconds).  Because we merged
                        many Level 2 records to get one merged record to fit, 
                        this value can vary greatly.

parameters.name: SC_R
parameters.description:
Spacecraft's Radial distance from Jupiter, in RJ.     
                        [1 RJ = 71492 km = 1 Jovian Radius]

parameters.name: SC_LT
parameters.description: Spacecraft's Local Time, in hours.

parameters.name: SC_LAT
parameters.description: Spacecraft's Jovian Latitude, in degrees.

parameters.name: SC_CLAT
parameters.description: Spacecraft's Centrifugal Latitude, in degrees.

parameters.name: SC_SIII
parameters.description: Spacecraft's SYSIII West Longitude, in degrees.

parameters.name: SC_COROT
parameters.description:
Rigid corotation velocity at Spacecraft's position,   
                        in km/s.

parameters.name: M
parameters.description: Assumed mass of ion used in fit, in amu.

parameters.name: Q
parameters.description:
Assumed charge of ion used in fit, in elementary      
                        charges (e).

parameters.name: LOWER_LIMIT_VR
parameters.description:
Lower fitting limit of Vr (LowerLim_Vr) used in       
                        process, units of km/s.                               
                        During the fitting process, free parameters are only
                        allowed to vary between these lower and upper limits.

parameters.name: LOWER_LIMIT_VTHETA
parameters.description:
Lower fitting limit of Vtheta (LowerLim_Vt) used in   
                        process, units of km/s.                               
                        [This value is fixed at -200.000 for all records.]    
                        During the fitting process, free parameters are only
                        allowed to vary between these lower and upper limits.

parameters.name: LOWER_LIMIT_VPHI
parameters.description:
Lower fitting limit of Vphi (LowerLim_Vp) used in     
                        process, units of km/s.                               
                        [This value is fixed at -200.000 for all records.]    
                        During the fitting process, free parameters are only
                        allowed to vary between these lower and upper limits.

parameters.name: LOWER_LIMIT_N
parameters.description:
Lower fitting limit of n (LowerLim_n) used in         
                        process, units of cm^-3.                              
                        During the fitting process, free parameters are only
                        allowed to vary between these lower and upper limits.

parameters.name: LOWER_LIMIT_T
parameters.description:
Lower fitting limit of T (LowerLim_T) used in         
                        process, units of eV.                                 
                        [This value is fixed at 0.001 for all records.]       
                        During the fitting process, free parameters are only
                        allowed to vary between these lower and upper limits.

parameters.name: UPPER_LIMIT_VR
parameters.description:
Upper fitting limit of Vr (UpperLim_Vr) used in       
                        process, units of km/s.                               
                        During the fitting process, free parameters are only
                        allowed to vary between these lower and upper limits.

parameters.name: UPPER_LIMIT_VTHETA
parameters.description:
Upper fitting limit of Vtheta (UpperLim_Vt) used in   
                        process, units of km/s.                               
                        [This value is fixed at 200.000 for all records.]     
                        During the fitting process, free parameters are only
                        allowed to vary between these lower and upper limits.

parameters.name: UPPER_LIMIT_VPHI
parameters.description:
Upper fitting limit of Vphi (UpperLim_Vp) used in     
                        process, units of km/s.                               
                        During the fitting process, free parameters are only
                        allowed to vary between these lower and upper limits.

parameters.name: UPPER_LIMIT_N
parameters.description:
Upper fitting limit of n (UpperLim_n) used in         
                        process, units of cm^-3.                              
                        During the fitting process, free parameters are only
                        allowed to vary between these lower and upper limits.

parameters.name: UPPER_LIMIT_T
parameters.description:
Upper fitting limit of T (UpperLim_T) used in         
                        process, units of eV.                                 
                        [This value is fixed at 20000.000 for all records.]   
                        During the fitting process, free parameters are only
                        allowed to vary between these lower and upper limits.

parameters.name: RECORD_NUMBER_DATA_POINTS
parameters.description:
"Record's number of Data Points used in fit (#rdp).    
                        This is the number of points fitted in the reduced    
                        Chi square fit, always with 5 free parameters.        
                        Therefore degrees of freedom for each reduced Chi     
                        square fit is this value minus 5.

parameters.name: RECORD_NUMBER_EXPECTED
parameters.description:
Expected record number (ern) of sweeps to fully       
                        populate a merged-spin to fit.                        
                        Values are 8, 16 or 32, dependent on ACCUM_TIME.      
                        If this value does not match RECORD_NUMBER_ACTUAL     
                        then not all sweeps were available and the fit did    
                        not have an all sky view.

parameters.name: RECORD_NUMBER_ACTUAL
parameters.description:
Actual record number (arn) of sweeps available to     
                        populate a merged-spin to fit.                        
                        If this value does not match RECORD_NUMBER_EXPECTED   
                        then not all sweeps were available and the fit did    
                        not have an all sky view, or perhaps not all expected 
                        energy steps were returned.

parameters.name: RECORD_MIN_COUNT
parameters.description:
The minimum counts/accumulation observed (Min_Cnt)    
                        within the level 2 records for this merged-spin.      
                        E.g. provides an indication of background.

parameters.name: RECORD_MAX_COUNT
parameters.description:
The maximum counts/accumulation observed (Max_Cnt)    
                        within the level 2 records for this merged-spin.      
                        E.g. provides an indication of signal (rather than    
                        noise) when compared with RECORD_MIN_COUNT.

parameters.name: COST_OF_FIT
parameters.description:
Cost function of the fit (Fit_Cost), that is the      
                        value of the reduced Chi-Square plus any penalties.   
                        Since penalties were multiples of 10^6 and the maximum
                        seen in this file is under 8000, no penalties were    
                        hit in these fits, and the Cost function is equivalent
                        to the reduced Chi square value of the fit.

parameters.name: FIT_VR
parameters.description:
Fitted value of Vr (Fit_Vr), units of km/s.           
                        -> Value is really FIT_VR +/- UNCERTAINTY_VR.

parameters.name: FIT_VTHETA
parameters.description:
Fitted value of Vtheta (Fit_Vt), units of km/s.       
                        -> Value is really FIT_VTHETA +/- UNCERTAINTY_VTHETA.

parameters.name: FIT_VPHI
parameters.description:
Fitted value of Vphi (Fit_Vp), units of km/s.         
                        -> Value is really FIT_VPHI +/- UNCERTAINTY_VPHI.

parameters.name: FIT_N
parameters.description:
Fitted value of n (Fit_n), units of cm^-3.            
                        -> Value is really FIT_N +/- UNCERTAINTY_N.

parameters.name: FIT_T
parameters.description:
Fitted value of T (Fit_T), units of eV.               
                        -> Value is really FIT_T +/- UNCERTAINTY_T.

parameters.name: UNCERTAINTY_VR
parameters.description:
Uncertainty value of Vr (Sigma_Vr), units of km/s.    
                        -> Value is really FIT_VR +/- UNCERTAINTY_VR.         
                        Uncertainties are found from taking the square roots  
                        of the diagonal of the covariance matrix for the fit.

parameters.name: UNCERTAINTY_VTHETA
parameters.description:
Uncertainty value of Vtheta (Sigma_Vt), units of km/s.
                        -> Value is really FIT_VTHETA +/- UNCERTAINTY_VTHETA. 
                        Uncertainties are found from taking the square roots  
                        of the diagonal of the covariance matrix for the fit.

parameters.name: UNCERTAINTY_VPHI
parameters.description:
Uncertainty value of Vphi (Sigma_Vp), units of km/s.  
                        -> Value is really FIT_VPHI +/- UNCERTAINTY_VPHI.     
                        Uncertainties are found from taking the square roots  
                        of the diagonal of the covariance matrix for the fit.

parameters.name: UNCERTAINTY_N
parameters.description:
Uncertainty value of n (Sigma_n), units of cm^-3.     
                        -> Value is really FIT_N +/- UNCERTAINTY_N.           
                        Uncertainties are found from taking the square roots  
                        of the diagonal of the covariance matrix for the fit.

parameters.name: UNCERTAINTY_T
parameters.description:
Uncertainty value of T (Sigma_T), units of eV.        
                        -> Value is really FIT_T +/- UNCERTAINTY_T.           
                        Uncertainties are found from taking the square roots  
                        of the diagonal of the covariance matrix for the fit.

parameters.name: INDEPENTENT_STDDEV_VR
parameters.description:
The standard deviation (assuming our 5 free           
                        parameters are independent of each other) of          
                        Vr (Ind_SDev_Vr) , units of km/s.                     
                        HOWEVER, our free parameters are not independent of   
                        each other so you should use UNCERTAINTY_VR           
                        instead. This is here for comparison only.

parameters.name: INDEPENTENT_STDDEV_VTHETA
parameters.description:
The standard deviation (assuming our 5 free           
                        parameters are independent of each other) of          
                        Vtheta (Ind_SDev_Vt) , units of km/s.                 
                        HOWEVER, our free parameters are not independent of   
                        each other so you should use UNCERTAINTY_VTHETA       
                        instead. This is here for comparison only.

parameters.name: INDEPENTENT_STDDEV_VPHI
parameters.description:
The standard deviation (assuming our 5 free           
                        parameters are independent of each other) of          
                        Vphi (Ind_SDev_Vp) , units of km/s.                   
                        HOWEVER, our free parameters are not independent of   
                        each other so you should use UNCERTAINTY_VPHI         
                        instead. This is here for comparison only.

parameters.name: INDEPENTENT_STDDEV_N
parameters.description:
The standard deviation (assuming our 5 free           
                        parameters are independent of each other) of          
                        n (Ind_SDev_n) , units of cm^-3.                      
                        HOWEVER, our free parameters are not independent of   
                        each other so you should use UNCERTAINTY_N            
                        instead. This is here for comparison only.

parameters.name: INDEPENTENT_STDDEV_T
parameters.description:
The standard deviation (assuming our 5 free           
                        parameters are independent of each other) of          
                        T (Ind_SDev_T) , units of eV.                         
                        HOWEVER, our free parameters are not independent of   
                        each other so you should use UNCERTAINTY_T            
                        instead. This is here for comparison only.

parameters.name: JGR
parameters.description:
JGR use flag.                                         
                        1 = 'good' fit, used in our JGR paper.                
                        0 = 'bad' fit, not used in our JGR paper.             
                        
                        Our criteria for a 'good' fit is given in our JGR     
                        paper, however here we provide all fits for all the   
                        PLS data as your criteria may be stronger or weaker.  
                        If you publish on these results, you should state what
                        your criteria for good fits was.                      
                        
                        Our JGR paper has the following citation:             
                        Bagenal, F., R. J. Wilson, S. Siler, W. R. Paterson, and W. S. Kurth (2016), 
                        Survey of Galileo plasma observations in Jupiter's plasma sheet,             
                        J. Geophys. Res. Planets, 121, 871-894, doi:10.1002/2016JE005009.            
                        
                        Please cite this paper and this PDS volume if you     
                        use this dataset.
